Description: Rim fragment of North Ionian pottery plate with "sofa-rim"; slipped cream. On top of rim: outlined tongues, every sixth void, outside crenellation band; to inside, lotus and pendent palmette band. Underside has two bands at inner edge. Hard fired, brown clay (grey-brown core) moderately micaceous clay with moderate amounts of small to large lime inclusions and grey particles (Munsell 5YR 7/6). Two drill holes for sampling.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ3, Φ4 or Φ7. (probably)
Curator's comments: Belongs to British Museum GR 1965.9-30.704. Analysed with NAA by H. Mommsen (cf. Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006), sample Nauk 87, Group B. British Museum 1965,0930.704 was excavated from the Sanctuary of Aphrodite. In all likelihood, this sherd most likely came from the same area, despite the fact that no specific provenance was give for it.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p. 56, p. 57, fig. 5, Table 1)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. VII, no. 15)
Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 45, p. 47, pl. XI, no. 1-2)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 253, no. 402) (Incorrectly identified as Chian)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GI.014)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 87, Nau 27, pl. 6i-j)
